intro: Mariana eburnea f. hispanica, commonly known as the Spanish ivory tree, is a rare and ornamental plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, pale bark and fragrant, white flowers. The plant typically grows as a small tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a distinctive waxy texture. Due to its limited distribution and unique appearance, it is highly valued in horticultural collections.
